results.title: Three preschoolers
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “Time to grow”.
Case studies of three preschoolers, one middle class, one a twin in a culturally unfamiliar background, and one blind.

results.title: Risk and resilience
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Time to grow”.
Examines the psychological effect of child abuse on development as an on-going risk. Therapy for abused children and counselling for parents is included.

results.title: I, toddler
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:

Investigates the benefits of secure attachment of toddlers to care givers, allowing growing independence in an emotionally secure environment.

results.title: The First year
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Time to grow”.
This case study of the first year of a child’s life describes her growth and development and how her family, including her three year-old sister, adapt.

results.title: Leong, Angela: a cultural transition
results.creator_credit: Tony Wheeler, Jan Sharp, Film Australia and R P Birch and Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Leong, a Malaysian born Chinese, and Angela, an Australian born Chinese, both talk about their attitudes towards being assimilated into Australian society.

results.title: Margaret: a pride in identity
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Margaret is an urban aboriginal woman who became involved in the pre-school Murawina, first as a mother then later as a trainee pre-school teacher. Margaret is shown at home with her white Australian husband and at work. The film stresses the importance of Aboriginal identity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Margaret is an urban aboriginal woman who became involved in the pre-school Murawina, first as a mother then later as a trainee pre-school teacher. Margaret is shown at home with her white Australian husband and at work. The film stresses the importance of Aboriginal identity.

results.title: Clem and Faye
results.creator_credit: Curtis Levy, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A biographical account of the life style of an Australian family living in Woolgoolga, a small town on the New South Wales coast. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Infant mind
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Coastline Community College and Southern California Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discussion of the theories of Jean Piaget on cognitive development. Interviews with child psychologists who comment on the development of thinking, learning and problem solving.

results.title: Mick: revisited
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Second part of a longitudinal study of Mick, an adolescent from Sydney’s western suburbs. Looks at the effects that the first film, made two years earlier, had on him and explores his attitudes towards his ethnic background. (See the first part “Mick” (Title code 012708).
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
